translated: Record of the True Lineage of the Transmission of the Dharma, Scroll 8
Compiled by Shi Qisong, a monk from Dongshan in Tengzhou, Song Dynasty
Brief Biographies of the Lineages of the True School, Part 2
The eighth generation from the Great Mirror.
Chan Master Wenyan of Yunmen Mountain in Shaozhou.
He was from Jiaxing, Suzhou.
His surname was Zhang.
He had an extraordinary nature.
As a child, he was unlike ordinary children.
He left home and received the precepts.
He studied sutras, vinaya, and treatises, and in a short time he understood them all.
Then he went to visit virtuous and wise teachers.
He had an audience with Venerable Muzhou once.
He greatly understood the fundamental purport.
He then received confirmation from Chan Master Xuefeng.
From then on, he hid his light and mingled with the crowd.
Because he traveled south, he arrived at the Dharma assembly of Chan Master Lingru Min at Shaoyang.
Min was an extraordinary person.
He was called able to predict.
He saw Yan and especially valued him.
He then ordered him to be the first seat of the assembly.
When Min passed away, he left a letter recommending him to the lord Liu.
Chan Master Ming succeeded him as the abbot.
Later, the Liu family restored Yunmen's great monastery.
They moved Yan to be the abbot.
His reputation then became widely known.
Learners from all directions came to him like water flowing downward.
However, his style of teaching was steep and swift.
Those who sought the Way became more numerous.
Today, the world reveres him and calls it the Yunmen school.
His dharma heirs numbered eighty-eight in total.ğŸ”½The first was Chan Master Baiyun Xiang of Shaozhou.

He said, The second-generation Huanglong Chan Master.
The tenth generation from the Great Mirror.
Chan Master Wenyi of Qingliang in Jinling.
He was from Yuhang.
His surname was Lu.
He had lofty aspirations from an early age.
After receiving the precepts, he studied the Vinaya with Vinaya Master Xiguo.
On the side, he explored Confucian learning.
His literary and artistic skills were impressive.
Xiguo often said of him, This is the wandering scholar of our school.
He then focused on the Chan teachings.
He finally went to the Dharma assembly of Changqing in Futan.
Before long, he was already being pushed by the assembly.
Later, he traveled again.
On the way, he encountered rain.
Together with his companions, he gradually rested at Dizang Temple in the western part of the state.
He then visited Chan Master Chen.
He attained the essential Dharma.
He stayed at the hermitage on Ganjiang Island in Fuzhou.
Later, he traveled with his companions to the Jiangnan region and arrived in Linchuan.
The people of the prefecture requested him to reside at Chongshou Monastery.
From then on, his students gradually increased.
The ruler of the Southern Tang, Li clan,
heard of his reputation and invited him to the capital.
He was appointed to lead the Qingliang Monastery.
The state's respect for him became even greater.
The number of disciples from all directions who returned to him increased even more.
Up to the present, his teachings spread throughout the world.
It is called the Qingliang school.
The Dharma heirs he produced numbered sixty-three in total.

The first is the one from Mount Lu, Huirui Zhiduoluo.
The commentator says:
The transmission of the orthodox teaching up to the great mirror is already extensive.
Yet students each pursue the teachings of their own masters.
Thus, the world is divided.
They compete to establish their own families.ğŸ”½Therefore, there are those who say it is the teachings of Hongzhou.

If this continues, it will be impossible to count.
But the disciples of the three families of Yunmen, Linji, and Fayan
are still flourishing.
The teachings of Hongzhou have already been extinguished.
And the teachings of Caodong are barely surviving.
It is like a solitary spring in a great drought.
But how can the flourishing and decline of the teachings be due to their strength or weakness?
It is simply a matter of whether the later generations who transmit them can find the right people or not.
